pkgmetadata.longdescription:
inits is a minimal init system written in C99 and POSIX shell, designed for simplicity and portability across UNIX-like systems. It provides runlevel-based service execution with predictable ordering through filename conventions.
Features: - 10 runlevels (0-9) for different system states - Predictable service execution order based on filenames - Multi-runlevel service support - Comprehensive logging to /var/log/inits.log - Graceful shutdown with SIGTERM/SIGKILL handling - No configuration files required - POSIX compliant

use.flag: Build with debug symbols and verbose logging output. Useful for development and troubleshooting.
Install example service scripts to demonstrate proper service script format and naming conventions.
Build a statically linked binary. Useful for rescue systems, minimal environments, or when you need inits to work without shared library dependencies.
Install systemd-compatible symlinks (e.g., inits-multi-user.target, inits-graphical.target) for easier migration from systemd-based systems.
Run test suite during build to verify service discovery and execution functionality.
